Utility

BatchEvaluation

class commonroad_crime.utility.batch_evaluation.ScenarioLoader(scenario_folder: str)[source]

Bases: object

commonroad_crime.utility.batch_evaluation.initialize_process(batch_path: str, flag_multi_processing: bool = True)[source]
commonroad_crime.utility.batch_evaluation.run_parallel(config: CriMeConfiguration)[source]

Parallel batch evaluation of measures, where the computation of criticality is carried out on multiple threads simultaneously. This reduces the runtime required to test your metric on more scenarios. One drawback is that it is not very easy to debug your code with parallel batch evaluation.

commonroad_crime.utility.batch_evaluation.run_sequential(scenario_path: str, measures: List[Type[CriMeBase]], config_root: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Sequential batch evaluation of measures, where the computation of criticality is carried out on a single thread. This is more user-friendly choice for test your metric on more scenarios since you can easily debug your code in your IDEs by creating breakpoints.

commonroad_crime.utility.batch_evaluation.write_result_to_csv(result_dict: Dict, batch_path: str)[source]

Solver

commonroad_crime.utility.solver.compute_acceleration(current_velocity: float, next_velocity: float, dt: float)[source]

Computes acceleration given velocity

Parameters:

  • current_velocity – velocity of current time step

  • next_velocity – velocity of previous time step

  • dt – time step size

Returns:

acceleration

commonroad_crime.utility.solver.compute_clcs_distance(clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem, veh_rear_pos: ndarray, veh_front_pos: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float][source]

Compute the distance between two vehicles along the curvilinear coordinate system. The sign of the distance is based on the assumption of the relative position of the vehicles. If the distance > 0, the relative position relationship holds. And vice versa.

Parameters:

  • clcs – curvi-linear coordinate system

  • veh_rear_pos – the position of the rear vehicle

  • veh_front_pos – the position of the front vehicle

:return the longitudinal and lateral relative distances

commonroad_crime.utility.solver.compute_closest_coordinate_from_list_of_points(state: State, vertices: ndarray)[source]

Computes the closest coordinate from a list of points

commonroad_crime.utility.solver.compute_disc_radius_and_distance(length: float, width: float) → Tuple[float, float][source]

Computes the radius of discs and their distances used as the approximation of the shape of the ego vehicle.

commonroad_crime.utility.solver.compute_jerk(current_acceleration: float, next_acceleration: float, dt: float) → float[source]

Computes jerk given acceleration

Parameters:

  • current_acceleration – acceleration of current time step

  • next_acceleration – acceleration of previous time step

  • dt – time step size

Returns:

jerk

commonroad_crime.utility.solver.compute_lanelet_width_orientation(lanelet: Lanelet, position: ndarray) → Tuple[Optional[float], Optional[float]][source]

Parameters:

  • lanelet – a lanelet

  • position – position of the vehicle
